descriptions.zh: 春节是中国最重要的传统节日，标志着农历新年的开始。人们会团聚、吃团圆饭、贴春联、放鞭炮等。
descriptions.en: Spring Festival is the most important traditional holiday in China, marking the beginning of the lunar new year. People gather for reunion dinners, hang spring couplets, and set off firecrackers.

customs.zh: 贴春联、放鞭炮、吃团圆饭、发红包
customs.en: Hanging spring couplets, setting off firecrackers, having reunion dinners, giving red envelopes

descriptions.zh: 元宵节是春节后的第一个重要节日，人们会赏花灯、猜灯谜、吃元宵。
descriptions.en: The Lantern Festival is the first major festival after the Spring Festival. People enjoy lantern displays, solve lantern riddles, and eat sweet rice balls.

customs.zh: 赏花灯、猜灯谜、舞龙舞狮
customs.en: Viewing lanterns, solving riddles, dragon and lion dances

descriptions.zh: 清明节是中国传统的祭祀节日，人们会扫墓祭祖、踏青郊游。
descriptions.en: Qingming Festival is a traditional Chinese festival for ancestor worship. People visit graves, pay respects to ancestors, and enjoy spring outings.

customs.en: Tomb sweeping, spring outings, flying kites

descriptions.zh: 端午节是为纪念爱国诗人屈原而设立的节日，人们会赛龙舟、吃粽子、挂艾草。
descriptions.en: Dragon Boat Festival commemorates the patriotic poet Qu Yuan. People race dragon boats, eat sticky rice dumplings, and hang mugwort.

customs.en: Dragon boat racing, hanging mugwort, wearing fragrant pouches

foods.en: Zongzi (sticky rice dumplings), salted duck eggs

descriptions.zh: 中秋节是中国传统的团圆节日，人们会赏月、吃月饼、团聚。
descriptions.en: Mid-Autumn Festival is a traditional Chinese festival for family reunions. People admire the full moon, eat mooncakes, and gather with family.

customs.en: Moon viewing, eating mooncakes, admiring lanterns
